message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it proposes a 3D object detection system for autonomous driving that uses a monocular camera as the fundamental sensor for 2D object proposal and initial 3D bounding box prediction. Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of stereo cameras and LiDAR as adaptive plug-in sensors to refine the 3D box localization performance. The paper also mentions the use of instance vector representation to model the local geometry of observed elements, which is a common technique used in computer vision. The other likely sub-categories are robotics (cs.RO) and machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI) as the paper discusses the use of multiple sensors and proposes a framework for multi-sensor refinement. The paper may also belong to the natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-category as it uses technical language and terminology commonly used in computer vision and machine learning.
